div.div:
New Boston Local Schools
Responsible - Respectful - Be a Great Tiger

br.span: We will be having a socially distant graduation ceremony on May 15, 2020 at the stadium beginning at 6pm or in the Glenwood gym if there are weather issues. Attached is the process to be followed during this unique graduation ceremony. We are attempting to have the safest and best graduation ceremony possible while honoring Governor DeWine's directives. Please click here for the 2020 Socially Distant Graduation Ceremony Informational Document

p.span: As you may already know, the Governor has closed schools for the rest of the school year. This is a disappointing decision, but we all know that the safety and security of our students is a top priority! Students will continue to learn as we have learned the past 5 weeks until the end of the school year. We are postponing Prom and Graduation Ceremonies to a time in the summer where we are hoping to have less regulations on social distancing. This decision will rely on the Governor and County Health Departments orders. At this point in time, we have rescheduled Prom for Saturday, June 20th, and the Graduation Ceremony will be Saturday, June 27th. These dates are tentative! We cannot set anything as a definite! Hopefully we will know more about the world wide pandemic soon. As we prepare for this "Uncharted Territory", we will stay in communication with you by text and our all-call system. We will also post on Facebook and our Web page. Please know that we are all together in this, and we will try the best that we can to make the end of school year assignments and activities special! Let's stay Tiger Strong!! A Big Thank You goes out to our graduates, parents, family, staff, friends, and the Village of New Boston for letting the Class of 2020 know how special they are. I (We) enjoyed seeing your faces!!

br.span:
Due to current circumstances, students will not be able to pick up applications for scholarships in the Glenwood high school office. Students will need to print the applications below, complete, and mail to addresses listed on each application. Please email Rachelle [email protected] after you have mailed your applications and she will send in your transcript (if the scholarship requires a transcript).
New Boston Alumni Merit Application
New Boston Alumni Additional Application
Alumni Applications must be returned or postmarked on or before May 1, 2020
Richard A Kindinger Application
Richard A Kindinger must be returned or postmarked on or before May 6, 2020
Please click here to view NBLSD Updated School Closure Plan

br.span: A MANDATORY no-contact period is in effect for all school-sponsored sports March 17-April 5, 2020. Additionally, there will be a mandatory shut down of facilities used for the purpose of conducting athletics activities from March 17-April 5, 2020.

Please click on the following link to view a message from our Superintendent regarding the Coronavirus:
Coronavirus Letter to Parents/Guardians Dated: 3/3/2020

Mandatory College Credit Plus meeting December 4th at 6:00 pm in room 132 for any student wishing to participate in College Credit Plus (Ohio initiative that allows students to earn college credit and high school credit at the same time) for the 20-21 school year. A parnet or guardian MUST attend this meeting with the student.

br.span: A MANDATORY no-contact period is in effect for all school-sponsored sports March 17-April 5, 2020. Additionally, there will be a mandatory shut down of facilities used for the purpose of conducting athletics activities from March 17-April 5, 2020.

div.span:
Please click on the following link to view a message from our Superintendent regarding the Coronavirus:
Coronavirus Letter to Parents/Guardians Dated: 3/3/2020

Mandatory College Credit Plus meeting December 4th at 6:00 pm in room 132 for any student wishing to participate in College Credit Plus (Ohio initiative that allows students to earn college credit and high school credit at the same time) for the 20-21 school year. A parnet or guardian MUST attend this meeting with the student.
